intro: Rhynchospora bracteovillosa, commonly known as the hairy bract sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands and marshy areas of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Rhynchospora bracteovillosa is often found in disturbed wetland habitats and can tolerate a range of moisture conditions. Its hairy bracts and robust growth make it a distinctive species within its ecological community.
